issue.title: Organizations API: Organization should expose login, not User and ID

repository.name: jcabi-github
repository.description: Java Object-Oriented Wrapper of GitHub API, with a fake implementation of the entire GitHub API (for your tests)

issue.body:
I stumbled upon this issue while working on #101.

At the moment, the Organization defines the `user()` and `orgId()` methods, implying that the Organization is defined by a user and ID. However, based on http://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/, each organization should have its own login (in the same way that a user has its own login), although a User can have a list of organizations that he belongs to.

Now, shouldn't the interface `Organization` be defined in terms of its login (and define define a method `String login()`) instead? We can have the `id` property exposed by `Organization.Smart` instead of defined by the `Organization` interface as it is currently defined.

As for the `user()` I don't see why it belongs to the `Organization` interface, even if `User` can iterate through a list of organizations.
